question: What is the name of the first Kanda in Valmiki Ramayana?

response.user_query: What is the name of the first Kanda in Valmiki Ramayana?
response.expanded_query: The first Kanda in Valmiki Ramayana is called "Bala Kanda," which narrates the childhood and early life of Lord Rama, including his birth and the events leading to his marriage with Sita.

metadata.explanation: (He described) the killing of Vali (by Rama), the installation of Sugriva, the mourning of Tara, the waiting (for the search of Sita as per the pact of friendship with Sugriva), and the sojourn on the mountain during the rainy season.
metadata.shloka_text: वालिप्रमथनं चैव सुग्रीवप्रतिपादनम् । ताराविलापं समयं वर्षरात्रनिवासनम् ।।1.3.24।।
metadata.translation: वालिप्रमथनं चैव crushing of Vali by Rama, सुग्रीवप्रतिपादनम् proposal (installation) of Sugriva, ताराविलापम् mourning of Tara, समयम् agreement (waiting for the search of Sita as per the pact of friendship between Rama and Sugriva), वर्षरात्रनिवासनम् sojourn on the mountain during rainy season.

metadata.explanation: Thereafter, the cheerful Rama, bowed to the mighty ascetic Viswamitra and commenced his journey. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: ततः प्रीतमना रामो विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम्। अभिवाद्य महातेजा गमनायोपचक्रमे।।1.27.26।।
metadata.translation: ततः thereafter, महातेजाः highly splendorous, रामः Rama, प्रीतमनाः with pleased mind , विश्वामित्रं Visvamitra, महामुनिम् mighty ascetic, अभिवाद्य bowing with respect, गमनाय for  his journey, उपचक्रमे commenced.

metadata.explanation: Mighty Sri Rama inorder to please Kaikeyi and obey the word of command of his father, went to the forest and help the king to keep his promise to Kaikeyi.
metadata.shloka_text: स जगाम वनं वीर: प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्। पितुर्वचननिर्देशात्कैकेय्या: प्रियकारणात् ।।1.1.24।।
metadata.translation: वीर: स: that mighty  Sri Rama, कैकेय्या: Kaikeyi's, प्रियकारणात् with a view to gratify, पितु: father's, वचननिर्देशात् by the word of command, प्रतिज्ञाम् his promise, अनुपालयन् while obeying, वनम् forest,  जगाम went.

metadata.explanation: Then Rama vowed to slay Vali. The monkey (Sugriva) described about Vali's prowess to Rama.
metadata.shloka_text: प्रतिज्ञातं च रामेण तदा वालिवधं प्रति ।।1.1.62।। वालिनश्च बलं तत्र कथयामास वानर: ।
metadata.translation: तदा then, रामेण by Rama, वालिवधं प्रति about slaying of Vali, प्रतिज्ञातम् vowed, तत्र there, वानर: Sugriva, वालिन: Vali's, बलम् च prowess, कथयामास described.

metadata.explanation: (He described) Rama's association with Viswamitra, a variety of wonderful stories, the breaking of the great bow and his (Rama's) marriage with Janaki.
metadata.shloka_text: नानाचित्रकथाश्चान्या विश्वामित्रसमागमे । जानक्याश्च विवाहं च धनुषश्च विभेदनम् ।।1.3.11।।
metadata.translation: विश्वामित्रसमागमे his association with Visvamitra, अन्या: other, नाना चित्रकथा: several astonishing and varied  stories, जानक्या: with Janaki, विवाहं च marriage, धनुष: of great bow, विभेदनम् breaking of.

metadata.explanation: Foremost among the ascetics the son of Kusika (Viswamitra) delighted the charming  princes with enchanting tales. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: कथाभिरभिरामाभिरभिरामौ नृपात्मजौ। रमयामास धर्मात्मा कौशिको मुनिपुङ्गव:।।1.23.22।।
metadata.translation: धर्मात्मा the magnanimous, मुनिपुङ्गव: foremost of ascetics, कौशिक: son of Kusika, अभिरामौ charming, नृपात्मजौ princes, अभिरामाभि: by enchanting, कथाभि: tales, रमयामास delighted them.

metadata.explanation: The brave Bharata, who had conquered envy and hatred went to the forest in order to worship Rama's feet.
metadata.shloka_text: स जगाम वनं वीरो रामपादप्रसादक: ।। 1.1.34 ।।
metadata.translation: वीर: The brave person who had conquered envy and hatred, रामपादप्रसादक: in order to propitiate Rama's feet, स he, वनं forest, जगाम went.

metadata.explanation: Sri Rama, bestowed with all virtues, enhanced the joys of Kausalya,  He is like the sea in deportment and like Himavant in fortitude.
metadata.shloka_text: स च सर्वगुणोपेत: कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन: । समुद्र इव गाम्भीर्ये धैर्येण हिमवानिव ।।1.1.17।।
metadata.translation: कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन: he, who is enhancing the joys of Kausalya, स: च he also, सर्वगुणोपेत:  endowed with all virtues, गाम्भीर्ये in depth of his thoughts, समुद्र: इव like a sea, धैर्येण in fortitude, हिमवान् इव like Himavat mountain.

metadata.explanation: Mighty  Rama related to Sugriva all that had happened right from the beginning, more importantly Sita's abduction and also to Hanuman.
metadata.shloka_text: सुग्रीवाय च तत्सर्वं शंसद्रामो महाबल: ।।1.1.59।। आदितस्तद्यथावृत्तं सीतायाश्च विशेषत: ।
metadata.translation: महाबल: mighty and powerful, राम: Rama, आदित: right from the beginning, तत् सर्वम् all that story, विशेषत: particularly, सीतायाश्च Sita's, यथावृत्तं as it happened (abduction), सुग्रीवाय च to Sugriva, also to Hanuman, शंसत् related.

metadata.explanation: Thereafter Sugriva, king of monkeys filled with sorrow narrated to Rama out of friendship the entire account of his hostilities (with Vali).
metadata.shloka_text: ततो वानरराजेन वैरानुकथनं प्रति ।।1.1.61।। रामायावेदितं सर्वं प्रणयाद्दु:खितेन च ।
metadata.translation: तत: thereafter, दु:खितेन by him who was filled with sorrow, वानरराजेन by the king of monkeys, Sugriva, वैरानुकथनं प्रति his story about hostilities (with Vali), रामाय to Rama, सर्वम् entirely, प्रणयात् out of friendship, आवेदितम् was communicated.

metadata.explanation: Valmiki who practised religious austerities composed this entire epic named the Ramayana which constitutes the great history of Sita and the killing of Paulastya (Ravana).
metadata.shloka_text: काव्यं रामायणं कृत्स्नं सीतायाश्चरितं महत्। पौलस्त्यवधमित्येव चकार चरितव्रत:।।1.4.7।।
metadata.translation: चरितव्रत: (Valmiki) one who practised religious vows, कृत्स्नम् entire, काव्यम् epic, रामायणम् the Ramayana, सीताया: महत् चरितम् Sita's great history, पौलस्त्यवधम् इत्येव the slaying of Paulastya etc, चकार composed.

metadata.explanation: Parasurama, the competent son of Jamadagni, having praised Rama, the son of Dasaratha circumbulated him and left for his abode. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्सप्ततितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the seventysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: रामं दाशरथिं रामो जामदग्न्य: प्रशस्य च। तत: प्रदक्षिणी कृत्य जगामात्मगतिं प्रभु:।।1.76.24।।
metadata.translation: प्रभु: competent, जामदग्न्य: son of Jamadagni, राम: Parasurama, दाशरथिम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् Rama, प्रशस्य च having praised, तत: then, प्रदक्षिणीकृत्य having circumambulated him, आत्मगतिम् to his own abode, जगाम went.

metadata.explanation: Viswamitra walked in the forefront. Behind him was Rama, bow in hand, while in the archer, Sumitra's son (Lakshmana) with side locks of hair followed.
metadata.shloka_text: विश्वामित्रो ययावग्रे ततो रामो धनुर्धर:। काकपक्षधरो धन्वी तं च सौमित्रिरन्वगात्।।1.22.6।।
metadata.translation: विश्वामित्र: Viswamitra, अग्रे in the forefront, ययौ walked, तत: behind him, धनुर्धर: with bow in his hand, राम: Rama (followed), काकपक्षधर: having side locks of hair, धन्वी an archer, सौमित्रि: Sumitra's son Lakshmana, तम् अन्वगात् followed him.

metadata.explanation: O Sage if Rama could lift and string this bow I shall give my daughter Sita, not born from a woman, to him (son of Dasaratha)". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: यद्यस्य धनुषो राम: कुर्यादारोपणं मुने। सुतामयोनिजां सीतां दद्यां दाशरथेरहम्।।1.66.26।।
metadata.translation: मुने O Sage, राम: Rama, अस्य this, धनुष: bow's, आरोपणम् lifting, कुर्याद्यदि if he could do, अयोनिजाम् this girl born without a mother, सुताम् daughter, सीताम् Sita, अहम् I, दाशरथे: for Rama, दद्याम् shall give.

metadata.explanation: "O Rama this story of the daughter of the mountain has been narrated to you. Now listen with Lakshmana the tale of the birth of Ganga": इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: एष ते विस्तरो राम शैलपुत्र्या निवेदित:। गङ्गाया: प्रभवं चैव शृणु मे सहलक्ष्मण:।।1.36.27।।
metadata.translation: राम O Rama, शैलपुत्र्या: relating to the daughter of Himavat mountain, Uma, एष: विस्तर: this extensive story, ते to you, (कथित: has been narrated), गङ्गाया: च relating to Ganga,  प्रभवम् her birth, निवेदित: described, सह लक्ष्मण: together with Lakshmana, श्रुणु listen.

metadata.explanation: (He described) the making of, and dwelling in, a hut, the arrival of Bharata, Bharata's persuasion to Rama (to return to the kingdom), and Rama's performance the funeral ablution for his father.
metadata.shloka_text: वास्तुकर्म निवेशं च भरतागमनं तथा । प्रसादनं च रामस्य पितुश्च सलिलक्रियाम् ।।1.3.16।।
metadata.translation: वास्तुकर्म construction of a hut, निवेशं च dwelling in that hut, भरतागमनम् arrival of Bharata, रामस्य Rama's, प्रसादनं च propitiating, तथा and, पितु: his father's, सलिलक्रियाम् funeral rites.

metadata.explanation: Highly resplendent Valmiki, having visualised the story (of Rama), with his power of penance and blending the merits of attainment of worldly prosperity and pleasures together with the detailed description of the merit of righteousness as an end and aim, like an ocean filled with gems, got ready to compose the story of delightful Rama which regales everybody's ears.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्सर्वं तत्त्वतो दृष्ट्वा धर्मेण स महाद्युति: । अभिरामस्य रामस्य चरितं कर्तुमुद्यत: ।।1.3.7।। कामार्थगुणसंयुक्तं धर्मार्थगुणविस्तरम् । समुद्रमिव रत्नाढ्यं सर्वश्रुतिमनोहरम् ।।1.3.8।।
metadata.translation: महाद्युति: highly resplendent, स: that Valmiki, तत् सर्वम् all that history, तत्त्वत: truely,  धर्मेण with the power of righteousness, दृष्ट्वा having seen, कामार्थगुणसंयुक्तम् blended with merits of attainment of worldly prosperity and pleasures, धर्मार्थगुणविस्तरम् detailed description of the merit of righteousness (as an end and aim), रत्नाढ्यम् filled with  gems, समुद्रमिव like an  ocean, सर्वश्रुतिमनोहरम् captivating the ears and mind, अभिरामस्य delightful, रामस्य of Rama, चरितम् history, कर्तुम् to compose, उद्यत: got ready.

metadata.explanation: By receiving Rama, son of Dasaratha, as her husband, my daughter Sita will bring glory to my dynasty.
metadata.shloka_text: जनकानां कुले कीर्तिमाहरिष्यति मे सुता। सीता भर्तारमासाद्य रामं दशरथात्मजम्।।1.67.22।।
metadata.translation: मे my, सुता daughter, सीता Sita, दशरथात्मजम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् Rama, भर्तारम् as husband, आसाद्य after obtaining, जनकानाम् of Janaka's, कुले dynastry, कीर्तिम् glory, आहरिष्यति will bring.

metadata.explanation: Divine sage Valmiki composed events yet to happen on this earth in the history of Rama in Uttarakanda. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे तृतीयस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the third sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana in synopsis of the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: अनागतं च यत्किञ्चिद्रामस्य वसुधातले । तच्चकारोत्तरे काव्ये वाल्मीकिर्भगवानृषि: ।।1.3.38।।
metadata.translation: भगवान् divine, वाल्मीकि:ऋषि: sage Valmiki, रामस्य Rama's, यत्किञ्चित् which ever matter, वसुधातले on the earth, अनागतं च events yet to happen, तत् that, उत्तरे in Uttara, काव्ये kanda, चकार composed.

metadata.explanation: O Great ascetic (Vasishta), this one is my youger brother and I am the elder one. O preeminent among ascetics with immense pleasure I am giving these maidens, Sita to Rama and Urmila to Lakshmana. Be blessed
metadata.shloka_text: कनीयानेष मे भ्राता अहं ज्येष्ठो महामुने। ददामि परमप्रीतो वध्वौ ते मुनिपुङ्गव।।1.71.20।। सीतां रामाय भद्रं ते ऊर्मिला लक्ष्मणाय च।
metadata.translation: महामुने O Great ascetic, एष: this one, मे my, कनीयान् youger, भ्राता brother, अहम् I, ज्येष्ठ: elder, मुनिपुङ्गव preeminent among ascetics, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, ते those, वध्वौ two maidens, ददामि I am giving, सीतां रामाय Sita to Rama, ऊर्मिला लक्ष्मणाय Urmila to  Lakshmana, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.

metadata.explanation: The great ascetic Viswamitra, who was highly powerful related to the distinguished Janaka in full their undaunted journey to Siddhashrama and the slaughter of rakshasas there, the view of the city of Vishala, meeting with Ahalya and Gautama and the inquisitiveness about the great bow which brought them to Mithila and then kept quiet. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाणडे पञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: सिद्धाश्रमनिवासं च राक्षसानां वधं तथा।।1.50.23।। तच्चागमनमव्यग्रं विशालायाश्च दर्शनम्। अहल्यादर्शनं चैव गौतमेन समागमम्।।1.50.24।। महाधनुषि जिज्ञासां कर्तुमागमनं तथा। एतत्सर्वं महातेजा जनकाय महात्मने ।।1.50.25।। निवेद्य विररामाथ विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:।
metadata.translation: महातेजा: highly lustrous, महामुनि: great ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, सिद्धाश्रमनिवासं च their stay at siddha ashrama, तथा and, राक्षसानाम् rakshasas', वधम् slaying, अव्यग्रम् undaunted, तत् आगमनम् that journey, विशालाया: Vishala's, दर्शनम् sight of, अहल्या दर्शनं चैव appearance of Ahalya, गौतमेन by Gautama, समागमम् meeting, तथा and, महाधनुषि in Siva's great bow, जिज्ञासाम् inquisitiveness, कर्तुम् to know, आगमनम् purpose of their arrival, एतत्सर्वम् all this, महात्मने to the distinguished, जनकाय for king Janaka, निवेद्य having related, अथ then, विरराम stopped.

metadata.explanation: Dasaratha, true to his word and restrained by the bond of duty, sent his beloved  son Rama to the forest.
metadata.shloka_text: स सत्यवचनाद्राजा धर्मपाशेन संयत: । विवासयामास सुतं रामं दशरथ: प्रियम् ।।1.1.23।।
metadata.translation: स: दशरथ: Dasaratha, सत्यवचनात् due to being truthful to his word, धर्मपाशेन by the bond of duty, संयत: restrained, प्रियं सुतम् beloved son, रामम् Rama, विवासयामास sent (to the forest).

metadata.comments: Valmiki composes the Ramayana in 24,000 verses -- teaches the verses to Kusa and Lava -- identifies Kusa and Lava for propagating the poem because of their melodious voice -- Kusa and Lava travel from place to place singing the Ramayana kavya--they sing at the assembly of rishis at aswamedha -- Sri Rama invites them to his palace and hears the Ramayana chanted by them.
metadata.explanation: The divine sage Valmiki, composed in wonderful lines the entire lifestory of Rama who regained his kingdom.
metadata.shloka_text: प्राप्तराज्यस्य रामस्य वाल्मीकिर्भगवानृषि:। चकार चरितं कृत्स्नं विचित्रपदमात्मवान्।।1.4.1।।
metadata.translation: भगवान् possessing divinity, आत्मवान् possessing spiritual wisdom, ऋषि: sage having the qualities of a poet, वाल्मीकि: Valmiki, प्राप्तराज्यस्य of him who gained the kingdom, रामस्य Rama's, विचित्रपदम् employing varied words causing astonishment, कृत्स्नम् entire, चरितम् history, चकार composed.

metadata.explanation: Born in the race of Janaka and daughterinlaw of Dasaratha, Sita, beloved spouse of Rama is like  his vital breath always desired the wellbeing of Rama she followed him like Rohini, the Moon. Endowed with all virtues she is the foremost woman.
metadata.shloka_text: रामस्य दयिता भार्या नित्यं प्राणसमा हिता ।।1.1.26।। जनकस्य कुले जाता देवमायेव निर्मिता । सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्ना नारीणामुत्तमा वधू: ।।1.1.27।। सीताप्यनुगता रामं शशिनं रोहिणी यथा ।
metadata.translation: रामस्य for Rama, दयिता beloved, भार्या wife, प्राणसमा equal to his vital breath, नित्यम् always, हिता doing fit and proper acts beneficial to him, जनकस्य king Janaka's, कुले in the  race, जाता born, निर्मिता created, देवमायेव like Maya Mohini, the assumed form of visnuhnu,  सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्ना endowed with all auspicious characteristics, नारीणाम् among women, उत्तमा the foremost, वधू: daughterinlaw (of Dasaratha), सीतापि Sita also, रोहिणी Rohini, (one of the several daughters of Daksha and consort of moon) शशिनम् यथा like moon, रामम् Rama, अनुगता followed.

metadata.explanation: In order to assist Rama, this earth was filled with commanders of those who led the monkey forces resembling masses of clouds and mountains. They loan endowed with immense strength and fearful forms and countenances. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: तैर्मेघबृन्दाचलकूटकल्पै: महाबलैर्वानरयूथपालै:। बभूव भूर्भीमशरीररूपै स्समावृता रामसहायहेतो:।।1.17.35।।
metadata.translation: मेघबृन्दाचलकूटकल्पै: resembling masses of clouds and mountain peaks,महाबलै: by those endowed with immense strength, भीमशरीररूपै: by those having fearful forms and countenances, तै: वानरयूथपालै: by commanders of  the monkey forces, भू: earth, रामसहायहेतो: in order to assist Rama, समावृता बभूव became covered.

metadata.explanation: Rama entered the city of Lanka by means of that bridge, killed Ravana in the battle and recovered Sita. Thereafter he felt greatly embarassed (for accepting his wife who had stayed in an others.
metadata.shloka_text: तेन गत्वा पुरीं लङ्कां हत्वा रावणमाहवे । राम: सीतामनुप्राप्य परां व्रीडामुपागमत् ।।1.1.81।।
metadata.translation: राम: Rama, तेन through that bridge, लङ्कापुरीं city of Lanka, गत्वा having reached, आहवे in the battle, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after slaying, सीताम् Sita, प्राप्य having recovered, अनु thereafter, पराम् great, व्रीडाम् embarassment, उपागमत् experienced (pursuant to her stay in others' house for a long time).

metadata.explanation: Rama spoke harsh words about Sita in the assembly. Sita, incapable of enduring such words, entered fire.
metadata.shloka_text: तामुवाच ततो राम: परुषं जनसंसदि । अमृष्यमाणा सा सीता विवेश ज्वलनं सती ।।1.1.82।।
metadata.translation: तत: for that reason, राम: Rama, जनसंसदि in the assembly of men, ताम् about Sita, परुषम् harsh words, उवाच spoke, सती chaste, सा सीता Sita, अमृष्यमाणा incapable of enduring those words, ज्वलनं विवेश entered flaming fire.

metadata.explanation: The king entered the inner apartment, duly offered him his daughter Shanta in marriage and experienced peace and satisfaction. Thus he (Rsyasringa) lived there, with all his desires fulfilled" (said Sumantra). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे दशमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the tenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: अन्त:पुरं प्रविश्यास्मै कन्यां दत्त्वा यथाविधि। शान्तां शान्तेन मनसा राजा हर्षमवाप स:।।1.10.31।। एवं स न्यवसत्तत्र सर्वकामैस्सुपूजित:।
metadata.translation: स: राजा the king, अन्त:पुरम् inner apartment, प्रविश्य having entered, कन्याम् daughter, शान्ताम् Shanta, अस्मै for him, यथाविधि in accordance with rules, दत्वा united him in marriage, शान्तेन peaceful, मनसा mind, हर्षम् satisfaction, अवाप experienced. स: Rsyasringa, एवम् in this way, सर्वकामै: all desires, सुपूजित: respectfully ministered, तत्र there, न्यवसत् lived.

metadata.explanation: Highly resplendent Valmiki, having visualised the story (of Rama), with his power of penance and blending the merits of attainment of worldly prosperity and pleasures together with the detailed description of the merit of righteousness as an end and aim, like an ocean filled with gems, got ready to compose the story of delightful Rama which regales everybody's ears.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्सर्वं तत्त्वतो दृष्ट्वा धर्मेण स महाद्युति: । अभिरामस्य रामस्य चरितं कर्तुमुद्यत: ।।1.3.7।। कामार्थगुणसंयुक्तं धर्मार्थगुणविस्तरम् । समुद्रमिव रत्नाढ्यं सर्वश्रुतिमनोहरम् ।।1.3.8।।
metadata.translation: महाद्युति: highly resplendent, स: that Valmiki, तत् सर्वम् all that history, तत्त्वत: truely,  धर्मेण with the power of righteousness, दृष्ट्वा having seen, कामार्थगुणसंयुक्तम् blended with merits of attainment of worldly prosperity and pleasures, धर्मार्थगुणविस्तरम् detailed description of the merit of righteousness (as an end and aim), रत्नाढ्यम् filled with  gems, समुद्रमिव like an  ocean, सर्वश्रुतिमनोहरम् captivating the ears and mind, अभिरामस्य delightful, रामस्य of Rama, चरितम् history, कर्तुम् to compose, उद्यत: got ready.

metadata.comments: King Janaka honours Viswamitra, Rama and Lakshmana--narrates the story about the bow of Mahadeva--declares he would give Sita in marriage to Rama if he strings the bow.
metadata.explanation: The day dawned bright and clear when the king (Janaka) performed his daily routine rites and welcomed the great Viswamitra with the two Raghavas (Rama and Lakshmana).
metadata.shloka_text: तत: प्रभाते विमले कृतकर्मा नराधिप:। विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं आजुहाव सराघवम्।।1.66.1।।
metadata.translation: तत: thereafter, विमले in the pure light, प्रभाते of dawn, नराधिप: king, कृतकर्मा having performed daily devotions, सराघवम् together with two Raghavas, महात्मानम् magnanimous Visvamitra, आजुहाव invited.

retrieval_results.expandedQuery: The first Kanda in Valmiki Ramayana is called "Bala Kanda," which narrates the childhood and early life of Lord Rama, including his birth and the events leading to his marriage with Sita.

generation_result.answer: The first Kanda in the Valmiki Ramayana is called the Bala Kanda [Bala-Kanda 66.1]. This Kanda covers the early life of Rama, including the stories of his birth and education [Bala-Kanda 3.11]. Events such as his journey with sage Viswamitra, various adventures, and his marriage to Sita are narrated in this section [Bala-Kanda 27.26, Bala-Kanda 66.26].

full_response.answer: The first Kanda in the Valmiki Ramayana is called the Bala Kanda [Bala-Kanda 66.1]. This Kanda covers the early life of Rama, including the stories of his birth and education [Bala-Kanda 3.11]. Events such as his journey with sage Viswamitra, various adventures, and his marriage to Sita are narrated in this section [Bala-Kanda 27.26, Bala-Kanda 66.26].
full_response.explanation: The Bala Kanda is described as the section of the Ramayana that includes Rama’s association with sage Viswamitra as well as his marriage to Sita, which are key events in this Kanda [Bala-Kanda 27.26, Bala-Kanda 66.26]. The Kanda also starts with descriptions of Rama's birth and upbringing [Bala-Kanda 3.11]. Throughout, the text provides a summary of the early and formative years of Rama's life, marking the beginning of the epic narrative [Bala-Kanda 66.1].

question: What is the name of the first Kanda in Valmiki Ramayana?

response.user_query: What is the name of the first Kanda in Valmiki Ramayana?
response.expanded_query: The first Kanda in Valmiki Ramayana is called "Bala Kanda," which narrates the childhood and early life of Lord Rama, including his birth and the events leading to his marriage with Sita.

metadata.explanation: (He described) the killing of Vali (by Rama), the installation of Sugriva, the mourning of Tara, the waiting (for the search of Sita as per the pact of friendship with Sugriva), and the sojourn on the mountain during the rainy season.
metadata.shloka_text: वालिप्रमथनं चैव सुग्रीवप्रतिपादनम् । ताराविलापं समयं वर्षरात्रनिवासनम् ।।1.3.24।।
metadata.translation: वालिप्रमथनं चैव crushing of Vali by Rama, सुग्रीवप्रतिपादनम् proposal (installation) of Sugriva, ताराविलापम् mourning of Tara, समयम् agreement (waiting for the search of Sita as per the pact of friendship between Rama and Sugriva), वर्षरात्रनिवासनम् sojourn on the mountain during rainy season.

metadata.explanation: Thereafter, the cheerful Rama, bowed to the mighty ascetic Viswamitra and commenced his journey. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: ततः प्रीतमना रामो विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम्। अभिवाद्य महातेजा गमनायोपचक्रमे।।1.27.26।।
metadata.translation: ततः thereafter, महातेजाः highly splendorous, रामः Rama, प्रीतमनाः with pleased mind , विश्वामित्रं Visvamitra, महामुनिम् mighty ascetic, अभिवाद्य bowing with respect, गमनाय for  his journey, उपचक्रमे commenced.

metadata.explanation: Mighty Sri Rama inorder to please Kaikeyi and obey the word of command of his father, went to the forest and help the king to keep his promise to Kaikeyi.
metadata.shloka_text: स जगाम वनं वीर: प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्। पितुर्वचननिर्देशात्कैकेय्या: प्रियकारणात् ।।1.1.24।।
metadata.translation: वीर: स: that mighty  Sri Rama, कैकेय्या: Kaikeyi's, प्रियकारणात् with a view to gratify, पितु: father's, वचननिर्देशात् by the word of command, प्रतिज्ञाम् his promise, अनुपालयन् while obeying, वनम् forest,  जगाम went.

metadata.explanation: Then Rama vowed to slay Vali. The monkey (Sugriva) described about Vali's prowess to Rama.
metadata.shloka_text: प्रतिज्ञातं च रामेण तदा वालिवधं प्रति ।।1.1.62।। वालिनश्च बलं तत्र कथयामास वानर: ।
metadata.translation: तदा then, रामेण by Rama, वालिवधं प्रति about slaying of Vali, प्रतिज्ञातम् vowed, तत्र there, वानर: Sugriva, वालिन: Vali's, बलम् च prowess, कथयामास described.

metadata.explanation: (He described) Rama's association with Viswamitra, a variety of wonderful stories, the breaking of the great bow and his (Rama's) marriage with Janaki.
metadata.shloka_text: नानाचित्रकथाश्चान्या विश्वामित्रसमागमे । जानक्याश्च विवाहं च धनुषश्च विभेदनम् ।।1.3.11।।
metadata.translation: विश्वामित्रसमागमे his association with Visvamitra, अन्या: other, नाना चित्रकथा: several astonishing and varied  stories, जानक्या: with Janaki, विवाहं च marriage, धनुष: of great bow, विभेदनम् breaking of.

metadata.explanation: Foremost among the ascetics the son of Kusika (Viswamitra) delighted the charming  princes with enchanting tales. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: कथाभिरभिरामाभिरभिरामौ नृपात्मजौ। रमयामास धर्मात्मा कौशिको मुनिपुङ्गव:।।1.23.22।।
metadata.translation: धर्मात्मा the magnanimous, मुनिपुङ्गव: foremost of ascetics, कौशिक: son of Kusika, अभिरामौ charming, नृपात्मजौ princes, अभिरामाभि: by enchanting, कथाभि: tales, रमयामास delighted them.

metadata.explanation: The brave Bharata, who had conquered envy and hatred went to the forest in order to worship Rama's feet.
metadata.shloka_text: स जगाम वनं वीरो रामपादप्रसादक: ।। 1.1.34 ।।
metadata.translation: वीर: The brave person who had conquered envy and hatred, रामपादप्रसादक: in order to propitiate Rama's feet, स he, वनं forest, जगाम went.

metadata.explanation: Sri Rama, bestowed with all virtues, enhanced the joys of Kausalya,  He is like the sea in deportment and like Himavant in fortitude.
metadata.shloka_text: स च सर्वगुणोपेत: कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन: । समुद्र इव गाम्भीर्ये धैर्येण हिमवानिव ।।1.1.17।।
metadata.translation: कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन: he, who is enhancing the joys of Kausalya, स: च he also, सर्वगुणोपेत:  endowed with all virtues, गाम्भीर्ये in depth of his thoughts, समुद्र: इव like a sea, धैर्येण in fortitude, हिमवान् इव like Himavat mountain.

metadata.explanation: Mighty  Rama related to Sugriva all that had happened right from the beginning, more importantly Sita's abduction and also to Hanuman.
metadata.shloka_text: सुग्रीवाय च तत्सर्वं शंसद्रामो महाबल: ।।1.1.59।। आदितस्तद्यथावृत्तं सीतायाश्च विशेषत: ।
metadata.translation: महाबल: mighty and powerful, राम: Rama, आदित: right from the beginning, तत् सर्वम् all that story, विशेषत: particularly, सीतायाश्च Sita's, यथावृत्तं as it happened (abduction), सुग्रीवाय च to Sugriva, also to Hanuman, शंसत् related.

metadata.explanation: Thereafter Sugriva, king of monkeys filled with sorrow narrated to Rama out of friendship the entire account of his hostilities (with Vali).
metadata.shloka_text: ततो वानरराजेन वैरानुकथनं प्रति ।।1.1.61।। रामायावेदितं सर्वं प्रणयाद्दु:खितेन च ।
metadata.translation: तत: thereafter, दु:खितेन by him who was filled with sorrow, वानरराजेन by the king of monkeys, Sugriva, वैरानुकथनं प्रति his story about hostilities (with Vali), रामाय to Rama, सर्वम् entirely, प्रणयात् out of friendship, आवेदितम् was communicated.

metadata.explanation: Valmiki who practised religious austerities composed this entire epic named the Ramayana which constitutes the great history of Sita and the killing of Paulastya (Ravana).
metadata.shloka_text: काव्यं रामायणं कृत्स्नं सीतायाश्चरितं महत्। पौलस्त्यवधमित्येव चकार चरितव्रत:।।1.4.7।।
metadata.translation: चरितव्रत: (Valmiki) one who practised religious vows, कृत्स्नम् entire, काव्यम् epic, रामायणम् the Ramayana, सीताया: महत् चरितम् Sita's great history, पौलस्त्यवधम् इत्येव the slaying of Paulastya etc, चकार composed.

metadata.explanation: Parasurama, the competent son of Jamadagni, having praised Rama, the son of Dasaratha circumbulated him and left for his abode. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्सप्ततितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the seventysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: रामं दाशरथिं रामो जामदग्न्य: प्रशस्य च। तत: प्रदक्षिणी कृत्य जगामात्मगतिं प्रभु:।।1.76.24।।
metadata.translation: प्रभु: competent, जामदग्न्य: son of Jamadagni, राम: Parasurama, दाशरथिम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् Rama, प्रशस्य च having praised, तत: then, प्रदक्षिणीकृत्य having circumambulated him, आत्मगतिम् to his own abode, जगाम went.

metadata.explanation: Viswamitra walked in the forefront. Behind him was Rama, bow in hand, while in the archer, Sumitra's son (Lakshmana) with side locks of hair followed.
metadata.shloka_text: विश्वामित्रो ययावग्रे ततो रामो धनुर्धर:। काकपक्षधरो धन्वी तं च सौमित्रिरन्वगात्।।1.22.6।।
metadata.translation: विश्वामित्र: Viswamitra, अग्रे in the forefront, ययौ walked, तत: behind him, धनुर्धर: with bow in his hand, राम: Rama (followed), काकपक्षधर: having side locks of hair, धन्वी an archer, सौमित्रि: Sumitra's son Lakshmana, तम् अन्वगात् followed him.

metadata.explanation: O Sage if Rama could lift and string this bow I shall give my daughter Sita, not born from a woman, to him (son of Dasaratha)". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: यद्यस्य धनुषो राम: कुर्यादारोपणं मुने। सुतामयोनिजां सीतां दद्यां दाशरथेरहम्।।1.66.26।।
metadata.translation: मुने O Sage, राम: Rama, अस्य this, धनुष: bow's, आरोपणम् lifting, कुर्याद्यदि if he could do, अयोनिजाम् this girl born without a mother, सुताम् daughter, सीताम् Sita, अहम् I, दाशरथे: for Rama, दद्याम् shall give.

metadata.explanation: "O Rama this story of the daughter of the mountain has been narrated to you. Now listen with Lakshmana the tale of the birth of Ganga": इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: एष ते विस्तरो राम शैलपुत्र्या निवेदित:। गङ्गाया: प्रभवं चैव शृणु मे सहलक्ष्मण:।।1.36.27।।
metadata.translation: राम O Rama, शैलपुत्र्या: relating to the daughter of Himavat mountain, Uma, एष: विस्तर: this extensive story, ते to you, (कथित: has been narrated), गङ्गाया: च relating to Ganga,  प्रभवम् her birth, निवेदित: described, सह लक्ष्मण: together with Lakshmana, श्रुणु listen.

metadata.explanation: (He described) the making of, and dwelling in, a hut, the arrival of Bharata, Bharata's persuasion to Rama (to return to the kingdom), and Rama's performance the funeral ablution for his father.
metadata.shloka_text: वास्तुकर्म निवेशं च भरतागमनं तथा । प्रसादनं च रामस्य पितुश्च सलिलक्रियाम् ।।1.3.16।।
metadata.translation: वास्तुकर्म construction of a hut, निवेशं च dwelling in that hut, भरतागमनम् arrival of Bharata, रामस्य Rama's, प्रसादनं च propitiating, तथा and, पितु: his father's, सलिलक्रियाम् funeral rites.

metadata.explanation: Highly resplendent Valmiki, having visualised the story (of Rama), with his power of penance and blending the merits of attainment of worldly prosperity and pleasures together with the detailed description of the merit of righteousness as an end and aim, like an ocean filled with gems, got ready to compose the story of delightful Rama which regales everybody's ears.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्सर्वं तत्त्वतो दृष्ट्वा धर्मेण स महाद्युति: । अभिरामस्य रामस्य चरितं कर्तुमुद्यत: ।।1.3.7।। कामार्थगुणसंयुक्तं धर्मार्थगुणविस्तरम् । समुद्रमिव रत्नाढ्यं सर्वश्रुतिमनोहरम् ।।1.3.8।।
metadata.translation: महाद्युति: highly resplendent, स: that Valmiki, तत् सर्वम् all that history, तत्त्वत: truely,  धर्मेण with the power of righteousness, दृष्ट्वा having seen, कामार्थगुणसंयुक्तम् blended with merits of attainment of worldly prosperity and pleasures, धर्मार्थगुणविस्तरम् detailed description of the merit of righteousness (as an end and aim), रत्नाढ्यम् filled with  gems, समुद्रमिव like an  ocean, सर्वश्रुतिमनोहरम् captivating the ears and mind, अभिरामस्य delightful, रामस्य of Rama, चरितम् history, कर्तुम् to compose, उद्यत: got ready.

metadata.explanation: By receiving Rama, son of Dasaratha, as her husband, my daughter Sita will bring glory to my dynasty.
metadata.shloka_text: जनकानां कुले कीर्तिमाहरिष्यति मे सुता। सीता भर्तारमासाद्य रामं दशरथात्मजम्।।1.67.22।।
metadata.translation: मे my, सुता daughter, सीता Sita, दशरथात्मजम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् Rama, भर्तारम् as husband, आसाद्य after obtaining, जनकानाम् of Janaka's, कुले dynastry, कीर्तिम् glory, आहरिष्यति will bring.

metadata.explanation: Divine sage Valmiki composed events yet to happen on this earth in the history of Rama in Uttarakanda. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे तृतीयस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the third sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana in synopsis of the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: अनागतं च यत्किञ्चिद्रामस्य वसुधातले । तच्चकारोत्तरे काव्ये वाल्मीकिर्भगवानृषि: ।।1.3.38।।
metadata.translation: भगवान् divine, वाल्मीकि:ऋषि: sage Valmiki, रामस्य Rama's, यत्किञ्चित् which ever matter, वसुधातले on the earth, अनागतं च events yet to happen, तत् that, उत्तरे in Uttara, काव्ये kanda, चकार composed.

metadata.explanation: O Great ascetic (Vasishta), this one is my youger brother and I am the elder one. O preeminent among ascetics with immense pleasure I am giving these maidens, Sita to Rama and Urmila to Lakshmana. Be blessed
metadata.shloka_text: कनीयानेष मे भ्राता अहं ज्येष्ठो महामुने। ददामि परमप्रीतो वध्वौ ते मुनिपुङ्गव।।1.71.20।। सीतां रामाय भद्रं ते ऊर्मिला लक्ष्मणाय च।
metadata.translation: महामुने O Great ascetic, एष: this one, मे my, कनीयान् youger, भ्राता brother, अहम् I, ज्येष्ठ: elder, मुनिपुङ्गव preeminent among ascetics, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, ते those, वध्वौ two maidens, ददामि I am giving, सीतां रामाय Sita to Rama, ऊर्मिला लक्ष्मणाय Urmila to  Lakshmana, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.

metadata.explanation: The great ascetic Viswamitra, who was highly powerful related to the distinguished Janaka in full their undaunted journey to Siddhashrama and the slaughter of rakshasas there, the view of the city of Vishala, meeting with Ahalya and Gautama and the inquisitiveness about the great bow which brought them to Mithila and then kept quiet. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाणडे पञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: सिद्धाश्रमनिवासं च राक्षसानां वधं तथा।।1.50.23।। तच्चागमनमव्यग्रं विशालायाश्च दर्शनम्। अहल्यादर्शनं चैव गौतमेन समागमम्।।1.50.24।। महाधनुषि जिज्ञासां कर्तुमागमनं तथा। एतत्सर्वं महातेजा जनकाय महात्मने ।।1.50.25।। निवेद्य विररामाथ विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:।
metadata.translation: महातेजा: highly lustrous, महामुनि: great ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, सिद्धाश्रमनिवासं च their stay at siddha ashrama, तथा and, राक्षसानाम् rakshasas', वधम् slaying, अव्यग्रम् undaunted, तत् आगमनम् that journey, विशालाया: Vishala's, दर्शनम् sight of, अहल्या दर्शनं चैव appearance of Ahalya, गौतमेन by Gautama, समागमम् meeting, तथा and, महाधनुषि in Siva's great bow, जिज्ञासाम् inquisitiveness, कर्तुम् to know, आगमनम् purpose of their arrival, एतत्सर्वम् all this, महात्मने to the distinguished, जनकाय for king Janaka, निवेद्य having related, अथ then, विरराम stopped.

metadata.explanation: Dasaratha, true to his word and restrained by the bond of duty, sent his beloved  son Rama to the forest.
metadata.shloka_text: स सत्यवचनाद्राजा धर्मपाशेन संयत: । विवासयामास सुतं रामं दशरथ: प्रियम् ।।1.1.23।।
metadata.translation: स: दशरथ: Dasaratha, सत्यवचनात् due to being truthful to his word, धर्मपाशेन by the bond of duty, संयत: restrained, प्रियं सुतम् beloved son, रामम् Rama, विवासयामास sent (to the forest).

metadata.comments: Valmiki composes the Ramayana in 24,000 verses -- teaches the verses to Kusa and Lava -- identifies Kusa and Lava for propagating the poem because of their melodious voice -- Kusa and Lava travel from place to place singing the Ramayana kavya--they sing at the assembly of rishis at aswamedha -- Sri Rama invites them to his palace and hears the Ramayana chanted by them.
metadata.explanation: The divine sage Valmiki, composed in wonderful lines the entire lifestory of Rama who regained his kingdom.
metadata.shloka_text: प्राप्तराज्यस्य रामस्य वाल्मीकिर्भगवानृषि:। चकार चरितं कृत्स्नं विचित्रपदमात्मवान्।।1.4.1।।
metadata.translation: भगवान् possessing divinity, आत्मवान् possessing spiritual wisdom, ऋषि: sage having the qualities of a poet, वाल्मीकि: Valmiki, प्राप्तराज्यस्य of him who gained the kingdom, रामस्य Rama's, विचित्रपदम् employing varied words causing astonishment, कृत्स्नम् entire, चरितम् history, चकार composed.

metadata.explanation: Born in the race of Janaka and daughterinlaw of Dasaratha, Sita, beloved spouse of Rama is like  his vital breath always desired the wellbeing of Rama she followed him like Rohini, the Moon. Endowed with all virtues she is the foremost woman.
metadata.shloka_text: रामस्य दयिता भार्या नित्यं प्राणसमा हिता ।।1.1.26।। जनकस्य कुले जाता देवमायेव निर्मिता । सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्ना नारीणामुत्तमा वधू: ।।1.1.27।। सीताप्यनुगता रामं शशिनं रोहिणी यथा ।
metadata.translation: रामस्य for Rama, दयिता beloved, भार्या wife, प्राणसमा equal to his vital breath, नित्यम् always, हिता doing fit and proper acts beneficial to him, जनकस्य king Janaka's, कुले in the  race, जाता born, निर्मिता created, देवमायेव like Maya Mohini, the assumed form of visnuhnu,  सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्ना endowed with all auspicious characteristics, नारीणाम् among women, उत्तमा the foremost, वधू: daughterinlaw (of Dasaratha), सीतापि Sita also, रोहिणी Rohini, (one of the several daughters of Daksha and consort of moon) शशिनम् यथा like moon, रामम् Rama, अनुगता followed.

metadata.explanation: Rama entered the city of Lanka by means of that bridge, killed Ravana in the battle and recovered Sita. Thereafter he felt greatly embarassed (for accepting his wife who had stayed in an others.
metadata.shloka_text: तेन गत्वा पुरीं लङ्कां हत्वा रावणमाहवे । राम: सीतामनुप्राप्य परां व्रीडामुपागमत् ।।1.1.81।।
metadata.translation: राम: Rama, तेन through that bridge, लङ्कापुरीं city of Lanka, गत्वा having reached, आहवे in the battle, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after slaying, सीताम् Sita, प्राप्य having recovered, अनु thereafter, पराम् great, व्रीडाम् embarassment, उपागमत् experienced (pursuant to her stay in others' house for a long time).

metadata.explanation: In order to assist Rama, this earth was filled with commanders of those who led the monkey forces resembling masses of clouds and mountains. They loan endowed with immense strength and fearful forms and countenances. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: तैर्मेघबृन्दाचलकूटकल्पै: महाबलैर्वानरयूथपालै:। बभूव भूर्भीमशरीररूपै स्समावृता रामसहायहेतो:।।1.17.35।।
metadata.translation: मेघबृन्दाचलकूटकल्पै: resembling masses of clouds and mountain peaks,महाबलै: by those endowed with immense strength, भीमशरीररूपै: by those having fearful forms and countenances, तै: वानरयूथपालै: by commanders of  the monkey forces, भू: earth, रामसहायहेतो: in order to assist Rama, समावृता बभूव became covered.

metadata.explanation: Rama spoke harsh words about Sita in the assembly. Sita, incapable of enduring such words, entered fire.
metadata.shloka_text: तामुवाच ततो राम: परुषं जनसंसदि । अमृष्यमाणा सा सीता विवेश ज्वलनं सती ।।1.1.82।।
metadata.translation: तत: for that reason, राम: Rama, जनसंसदि in the assembly of men, ताम् about Sita, परुषम् harsh words, उवाच spoke, सती chaste, सा सीता Sita, अमृष्यमाणा incapable of enduring those words, ज्वलनं विवेश entered flaming fire.

metadata.explanation: The king entered the inner apartment, duly offered him his daughter Shanta in marriage and experienced peace and satisfaction. Thus he (Rsyasringa) lived there, with all his desires fulfilled" (said Sumantra). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे दशमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the tenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: अन्त:पुरं प्रविश्यास्मै कन्यां दत्त्वा यथाविधि। शान्तां शान्तेन मनसा राजा हर्षमवाप स:।।1.10.31।। एवं स न्यवसत्तत्र सर्वकामैस्सुपूजित:।
metadata.translation: स: राजा the king, अन्त:पुरम् inner apartment, प्रविश्य having entered, कन्याम् daughter, शान्ताम् Shanta, अस्मै for him, यथाविधि in accordance with rules, दत्वा united him in marriage, शान्तेन peaceful, मनसा mind, हर्षम् satisfaction, अवाप experienced. स: Rsyasringa, एवम् in this way, सर्वकामै: all desires, सुपूजित: respectfully ministered, तत्र there, न्यवसत् lived.

metadata.explanation: Highly resplendent Valmiki, having visualised the story (of Rama), with his power of penance and blending the merits of attainment of worldly prosperity and pleasures together with the detailed description of the merit of righteousness as an end and aim, like an ocean filled with gems, got ready to compose the story of delightful Rama which regales everybody's ears.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्सर्वं तत्त्वतो दृष्ट्वा धर्मेण स महाद्युति: । अभिरामस्य रामस्य चरितं कर्तुमुद्यत: ।।1.3.7।। कामार्थगुणसंयुक्तं धर्मार्थगुणविस्तरम् । समुद्रमिव रत्नाढ्यं सर्वश्रुतिमनोहरम् ।।1.3.8।।
metadata.translation: महाद्युति: highly resplendent, स: that Valmiki, तत् सर्वम् all that history, तत्त्वत: truely,  धर्मेण with the power of righteousness, दृष्ट्वा having seen, कामार्थगुणसंयुक्तम् blended with merits of attainment of worldly prosperity and pleasures, धर्मार्थगुणविस्तरम् detailed description of the merit of righteousness (as an end and aim), रत्नाढ्यम् filled with  gems, समुद्रमिव like an  ocean, सर्वश्रुतिमनोहरम् captivating the ears and mind, अभिरामस्य delightful, रामस्य of Rama, चरितम् history, कर्तुम् to compose, उद्यत: got ready.

metadata.comments: King Janaka honours Viswamitra, Rama and Lakshmana--narrates the story about the bow of Mahadeva--declares he would give Sita in marriage to Rama if he strings the bow.
metadata.explanation: The day dawned bright and clear when the king (Janaka) performed his daily routine rites and welcomed the great Viswamitra with the two Raghavas (Rama and Lakshmana).
metadata.shloka_text: तत: प्रभाते विमले कृतकर्मा नराधिप:। विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं आजुहाव सराघवम्।।1.66.1।।
metadata.translation: तत: thereafter, विमले in the pure light, प्रभाते of dawn, नराधिप: king, कृतकर्मा having performed daily devotions, सराघवम् together with two Raghavas, महात्मानम् magnanimous Visvamitra, आजुहाव invited.

retrieval_results.expandedQuery: The first Kanda in Valmiki Ramayana is called "Bala Kanda," which narrates the childhood and early life of Lord Rama, including his birth and the events leading to his marriage with Sita.

generation_result.answer: The name of the first Kanda in Valmiki's Ramayana is the Bala-Kanda [Bala-Kanda 1.1, Bala-Kanda 3.38]. Valmiki, the divine sage endowed with spiritual wisdom, composed the entire history of Rama, who regained his kingdom, employing wonderful verses [Bala-Kanda 4.1]. This Bala-Kanda contains a summary of the entire epic, including events yet to happen on earth [Bala-Kanda 3.38].

full_response.answer: The name of the first Kanda in Valmiki's Ramayana is the Bala-Kanda [Bala-Kanda 1.1, Bala-Kanda 3.38]. Valmiki, the divine sage endowed with spiritual wisdom, composed the entire history of Rama, who regained his kingdom, employing wonderful verses [Bala-Kanda 4.1]. This Bala-Kanda contains a summary of the entire epic, including events yet to happen on earth [Bala-Kanda 3.38].
full_response.explanation: The citations establish that the first Kanda of the Ramayana is called the Bala-Kanda, and that this Kanda was composed by the divine sage Valmiki. The text states that the Bala-Kanda contains the entire history of Rama, including events yet to happen on earth, written in wonderful verses.

question: In which Kanda does the search for Sita begin in earnest?

response.user_query: In which Kanda does the search for Sita begin in earnest?
response.expanded_query: The search for Sita begins in earnest in the Aranya Kanda, where Rama and Lakshmana, after meeting with various sages, intensify their efforts to locate Sita following her abduction by Ravana.

metadata.explanation: 'Search all over the place looking carefully here and there for Sita the beloved consort of Rama, daughterinlaw of Dasaratha.
metadata.shloka_text: सर्वमेतद्विचेतव्यं मृगयद्भिस्ततस्ततः। रामस्य दयितां भार्यां सीतां दशरथस्नुषाम्।।4.40.24।।
metadata.translation: रामस्य Rama's, दयिताम् dear, भार्याम् wife, दशरथस्नुषाम् daughterinlaw of Dasaratha, सीताम् Sita, ततस्ततः in all places, मृगयद्भि: by searching, तत् सर्वम् all over, विचेतव्यम् search should be made.

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्र सीतां च मार्गध्वं निलयं रावणस्य च।।4.42.12।। वेलातलनिविष्टेषु पर्वतेषु वनेषु च। मुरचीपत्तनं चैव रम्यं चैव जटीपुरम्।।4.42.13।। अवन्तीमङ्गलोपां च तथा चालक्षितं वनम्। राष्ट्राणि च विशालानि पत्तनानि ततस्ततः।।4.42.14।।
metadata.translation: तत्र there,वेलातलनिविष्टेषु among those on the sea shore tract, पर्वतेषु in mountains, वनेषु in groves, सीतां च Sita's, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च  residence, मार्गध्वम् search, मुरचीपत्तनं चैव town of Murachi, रम्यम् beautiful, जटपुरं चैव and in the city of Jata, अवन्तीम् in Avanti, अङ्गलोपां च  in Angalopa city, तथा so also, अलक्षितम् unnoticed, वनम्  forest, ततस्ततः here and there, राष्ट्रणिच kingdoms, विशालानि vast, पत्तनानि towns

metadata.explanation: 'Search for Sita all over Vindhya of a thousand peaks filled with several trees and creepers, and along the river Narmada. Then proceed to Godavari, lovely Krishnaveni, Mahanadi, Varada and Mahabhaga inhabited by terrific serpents.You may search Mekhala, Utkala and Dasarna cities, Asvavanti and Avanti countries also.
metadata.shloka_text: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्। नर्मदां च नदीं रम्यां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.8।। ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णवेणीं महानदीम्। वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.9।। मेखलामुत्कलां चैव दशार्णनगराण्यपि। आश्ववन्तीमवन्तीं च सर्वामेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.10।।
metadata.translation: सहस्रशिरसम् of thousand peaks, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् filled with several trees and creepers, विन्ध्यम् Vindhya, नर्मदां नदीं च and river Narmada, ततः then, रम्याम् delightful, गोदावरीम् Godavari, महानदीम् Mahanadi, कृष्णवेणीम् Krishnaveni, महाभागाम् Mahabhaga, महोरगनिषेविताम् inhabited by terrific serpents, वरदां च and Varada river, मेखलाम् river Mekhala, उत्कलां च एव Utkala also, दशार्णनगराण्यपि towns of Dasarna, आश्ववन्तीम् Asvavanti, अवन्तीम् Avanti, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत you may survey.

metadata.explanation: 'Search for Sita all over Vindhya of a thousand peaks filled with several trees and creepers, and along the river Narmada. Then proceed to Godavari, lovely Krishnaveni, Mahanadi, Varada and Mahabhaga inhabited by terrific serpents.You may search Mekhala, Utkala and Dasarna cities, Asvavanti and Avanti countries also.
metadata.shloka_text: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्। नर्मदां च नदीं रम्यां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.8।। ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णवेणीं महानदीम्। वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.9।। मेखलामुत्कलां चैव दशार्णनगराण्यपि। आश्ववन्तीमवन्तीं च सर्वामेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.10।।
metadata.translation: सहस्रशिरसम् of thousand peaks, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् filled with several trees and creepers, विन्ध्यम् Vindhya, नर्मदां नदीं च and river Narmada, ततः then, रम्याम् delightful, गोदावरीम् Godavari, महानदीम् Mahanadi, कृष्णवेणीम् Krishnaveni, महाभागाम् Mahabhaga, महोरगनिषेविताम् inhabited by terrific serpents, वरदां च and Varada river, मेखलाम् river Mekhala, उत्कलां च एव Utkala also, दशार्णनगराण्यपि towns of Dasarna, आश्ववन्तीम् Asvavanti, अवन्तीम् Avanti, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत you may survey.

metadata.explanation: I will roam about the river Godavari, Janasthana and this mount Prasravana till I find Sita.
metadata.shloka_text: गोदावरीं जनस्थानमिमं प्रस्रवणं गिरिम्।।3.64.14।। सर्वाण्यनुगमिष्यामि यदि सीता हि दृश्यते।
metadata.translation: गोदावरीम् Godavari, जनस्थानम् Janasthanam, इमम् this, प्रस्रवणं Prasravana, गिरिम् mountain, सर्वाणि all, अनुगमिष्यामि will follow up, सीता Sita, यदि हि दृश्यते if Sita can be found.

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्र सीतां च मार्गध्वं निलयं रावणस्य च।।4.42.12।। वेलातलनिविष्टेषु पर्वतेषु वनेषु च। मुरचीपत्तनं चैव रम्यं चैव जटीपुरम्।।4.42.13।। अवन्तीमङ्गलोपां च तथा चालक्षितं वनम्। राष्ट्राणि च विशालानि पत्तनानि ततस्ततः।।4.42.14।।
metadata.translation: तत्र there,वेलातलनिविष्टेषु among those on the sea shore tract, पर्वतेषु in mountains, वनेषु in groves, सीतां च Sita's, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च  residence, मार्गध्वम् search, मुरचीपत्तनं चैव town of Murachi, रम्यम् beautiful, जटपुरं चैव and in the city of Jata, अवन्तीम् in Avanti, अङ्गलोपां च  in Angalopa city, तथा so also, अलक्षितम् unnoticed, वनम्  forest, ततस्ततः here and there, राष्ट्रणिच kingdoms, विशालानि vast, पत्तनानि towns

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्र सीतां च मार्गध्वं निलयं रावणस्य च।।4.42.12।। वेलातलनिविष्टेषु पर्वतेषु वनेषु च। मुरचीपत्तनं चैव रम्यं चैव जटीपुरम्।।4.42.13।। अवन्तीमङ्गलोपां च तथा चालक्षितं वनम्। राष्ट्राणि च विशालानि पत्तनानि ततस्ततः।।4.42.14।।
metadata.translation: तत्र there,वेलातलनिविष्टेषु among those on the sea shore tract, पर्वतेषु in mountains, वनेषु in groves, सीतां च Sita's, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च  residence, मार्गध्वम् search, मुरचीपत्तनं चैव town of Murachi, रम्यम् beautiful, जटपुरं चैव and in the city of Jata, अवन्तीम् in Avanti, अङ्गलोपां च  in Angalopa city, तथा so also, अलक्षितम् unnoticed, वनम्  forest, ततस्ततः here and there, राष्ट्रणिच kingdoms, विशालानि vast, पत्तनानि towns

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita in the countries of Vidarbha and Rishika, in the picturesque country of Mashaka, Vanga and Kalinga and all over Kausika. Look for her in mountains caves and on river banks, in Dandaka forest, in Godavari, in Andhra also in Pundra, Chola and Pandya countries and all over Kerala.
metadata.shloka_text: विदर्भानृषिकांश्चैव रम्यान्माहिषकानपि। तथा वङ्गान्कलिङ्गांश्च कौशिकांश्च समन्ततः।।4.41.11।। अन्वीक्ष्य दण्डकारण्यं सपर्वतनदीगुहाम्। नदीं गोदावरीं चैव सर्वमेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.12।। तथैवान्ध्रांश्च पुण्ड्रांश्च चोलान्पाण्ड्यांत्स केरलान्।
metadata.translation: विदर्भान् in Vidarbha, ऋषिकांश्चैव and in Rishika, रम्यान् picturesque, माहिषकानपि country of  Mahishaka, तथा so also, वङ्गकलिङ्गांश्च Vanga and Kalinga, समन्ततः all over, कौशिकांश्च Kausika, सपर्वतनदीगुहाम् in the mountains, river banks and caves, दण्डकारण्यम् in Dandaka forest, अन्वीक्ष्य after searching for, गोदावरीं Godavari, नदीं river, चैव also, तथैव in the same way, आन्ध्रांश्च Andhra also, पुण्ड्रांश्च country Pundra even, चोलान् Chola, पाण्ड्यांत्स Pandya country, केरलान् Kerala, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत search.

metadata.explanation: 'Search for Sita all over Vindhya of a thousand peaks filled with several trees and creepers, and along the river Narmada. Then proceed to Godavari, lovely Krishnaveni, Mahanadi, Varada and Mahabhaga inhabited by terrific serpents.You may search Mekhala, Utkala and Dasarna cities, Asvavanti and Avanti countries also.
metadata.shloka_text: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्। नर्मदां च नदीं रम्यां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.8।। ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णवेणीं महानदीम्। वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.9।। मेखलामुत्कलां चैव दशार्णनगराण्यपि। आश्ववन्तीमवन्तीं च सर्वामेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.10।।
metadata.translation: सहस्रशिरसम् of thousand peaks, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् filled with several trees and creepers, विन्ध्यम् Vindhya, नर्मदां नदीं च and river Narmada, ततः then, रम्याम् delightful, गोदावरीम् Godavari, महानदीम् Mahanadi, कृष्णवेणीम् Krishnaveni, महाभागाम् Mahabhaga, महोरगनिषेविताम् inhabited by terrific serpents, वरदां च and Varada river, मेखलाम् river Mekhala, उत्कलां च एव Utkala also, दशार्णनगराण्यपि towns of Dasarna, आश्ववन्तीम् Asvavanti, अवन्तीम् Avanti, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत you may survey.

metadata.explanation: 'Search for Sita in the abode of Ravana, on mountain peaks and river banks and in forests.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्र सीतां च वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च।।4.40.19।। मार्गध्वं गिरिशृङ्गेषु वनेषु च नदीषु च।
metadata.translation: तत्र there, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, सीतां च Sita also, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च in the abode, गिरिशृङ्गेषु on the mountain peaks, वनेषु च and in the forests, नदीषु च and river banks, मार्गध्वम् you may search for.

metadata.explanation: O king bow in hands, followed by me and with the help of great sages you should search for the one who has abducted Sita.
metadata.shloka_text: येन राजन्हृता सीता तमन्वेषितुमर्हसि।।3.65.12।। मद्वितीयो धनुष्पाणिस्सहायैः परमर्षिभिः।
metadata.translation: राजन् king, धनुष्पाणिः wielding a bow, मद्वितीयः followed by one, सहायैः with the help of, परमर्षिभिः by great sages, सीता Sita, येन whomsoever, हृता carried off, तम् him, अन्वेषितुम् to search, अर्हसि is proper for you.

metadata.explanation: 'Entering by night the inaccessible city of Ravana, I shall search all over the palace and find Sita'.
metadata.shloka_text: रावणस्य पुरीं रात्रौ प्रविश्य सुदुरासदाम्। विचिन्वन् भवनं सर्वं द्रक्ष्यामि जनकात्मजाम्।।5.2.47।।
metadata.translation: सुदुरासदाम् quite inaccessible, पुरीम् city, रात्रौ at night, प्रविश्य after entering, रावणस्य Ravana's, सर्वम् all, भवनम् palace, विचिन्वन् search all over, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, Sita, द्रक्ष्यामि I will see.

metadata.comments: Sugriva once again addresses all troops -- the vanaras departRama and Lakshmana return to Prasravana mountain
metadata.explanation: Summoning the entire body of vanaras, Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, said, 'Go to the places I have described and look for  Sita in order to fulfil Rama's objective'.
metadata.shloka_text: सर्वांश्चाहूय सुग्रीवः प्लवगान् प्लवगर्षभः। समस्तानब्रवीद्भूयो रामकार्यर्थसिद्धये।।4.45.1।। एवमेतद्विचेतव्यं यन्मया परिकीर्तितम्।
metadata.translation: प्लवगर्षभः bull of among monkeys, भूयः further, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, सर्वान् all, प्लवगान् vanaras, आहूय  called, रामकार्यर्थसिद्धये for fulfilling the objective of Rama, समस्तान् all of them, अब्रवीत् addressed, मया by me, यत् whatever, परिकीर्तितम् described, एवम् in the same way, एतत् thus, विचेतव्यम् you should search.

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita in the countries of Vidarbha and Rishika, in the picturesque country of Mashaka, Vanga and Kalinga and all over Kausika. Look for her in mountains caves and on river banks, in Dandaka forest, in Godavari, in Andhra also in Pundra, Chola and Pandya countries and all over Kerala.
metadata.shloka_text: विदर्भानृषिकांश्चैव रम्यान्माहिषकानपि। तथा वङ्गान्कलिङ्गांश्च कौशिकांश्च समन्ततः।।4.41.11।। अन्वीक्ष्य दण्डकारण्यं सपर्वतनदीगुहाम्। नदीं गोदावरीं चैव सर्वमेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.12।। तथैवान्ध्रांश्च पुण्ड्रांश्च चोलान्पाण्ड्यांत्स केरलान्।
metadata.translation: विदर्भान् in Vidarbha, ऋषिकांश्चैव and in Rishika, रम्यान् picturesque, माहिषकानपि country of  Mahishaka, तथा so also, वङ्गकलिङ्गांश्च Vanga and Kalinga, समन्ततः all over, कौशिकांश्च Kausika, सपर्वतनदीगुहाम् in the mountains, river banks and caves, दण्डकारण्यम् in Dandaka forest, अन्वीक्ष्य after searching for, गोदावरीं Godavari, नदीं river, चैव also, तथैव in the same way, आन्ध्रांश्च Andhra also, पुण्ड्रांश्च country Pundra even, चोलान् Chola, पाण्ड्यांत्स Pandya country, केरलान् Kerala, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत search.

metadata.explanation: Sugriva will find out the lady of purity and chastity brooding over you in separation in the abode of Ravana. He can send gigantic monkeys in different directions in order to search for her.
metadata.shloka_text: वानरांश्च महाकायान्प्रेषयिष्यति राघव।।3.72.25।। दिशो विचेतुं तां सीतां त्वद्वियोगेन शोचतीम्। स ज्ञास्यति वरारोहां निर्मलां रावणालये।।3.72.26।।
metadata.translation: राघव Rama, त्वद्वियोगेन by separation from you, शोचतीम् brooding, तां सीताम् that Sita, विचेतुम् to search, महाकायान् gigantic, वानरांश्च monkeys, दिशः in all directions, प्रेषयिष्यति he will send, सः he, रावणालये in Ravana's home, निर्मलाम् chaste, वरारोहाम् beautiful, ज्ञास्यति will find out.

metadata.explanation: Ravana thought that the broad eyed Sita coming to conclusion in course of time that Rama has gone along with Lakshmana, rid of hope, with no other haven, will seek him on her own accord.
metadata.shloka_text: अद्यकालवशंप्राप्तंरणेरामंसलक्ष्मणम् । अवेक्ष्यविनिवृत्तासाचान्यांगतिमपश्यती ।।6.47.10।। निरपेक्षाविशालाक्षीमामुपस्थास्यतेस्वयम् ।
metadata.translation: विशालाक्षी broad eyed, सा that, अद्य coming to conclusion, रणे war, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, कालवशम् in course of time, गतम् gone, अवेक्ष्य seek, विनिवृत्ता, अन्याम् no other, गतिम् haven, अपश्यती will seek, निरपेक्षा getting rid of hope, स्वयम् Ravana, माम् me, उपस्थास्यते will on her own accord.

metadata.explanation: 'We have searched here, there, everywhere, in dense forests, hills, forts, impenetrable caverns and mountain ranges. But we could find neither Janaki who is like a goddess nor the demon who abducted her.
metadata.shloka_text: वनानि गिरयो नद्यो दुर्गाणि गहनानि च। दर्यो गिरिगुहाश्चैव विचितानि समन्ततः।।4.49.2।। तत्र तत्र सहास्माभिर्जानकी न च दृश्यते। तद्वा रक्षो हृता येन सीता सुरसुतोपमा।।4.49.3।।
metadata.translation: अस्माभिः by all of us, सह along with, वनानि forests, गिरयः the mountains, नद्यः the rivers, दुर्गाणि inaccessible forts, गहनानि च dense, दर्यः caves, गिरिगुहाश्चैव and the mountain ranges also, समन्ततः all over, तत्र तत्र everywhere, विचितानि searched, जानकी Janaki, न दृश्यते is not seen, तदा then, सीता Sita, हृता येन by one who has stolen, सुरसुतोपमा one who is like a goddess, रक्षः च raksha, वा or.

metadata.explanation: Sugriva will find out the lady of purity and chastity brooding over you in separation in the abode of Ravana. He can send gigantic monkeys in different directions in order to search for her.
metadata.shloka_text: वानरांश्च महाकायान्प्रेषयिष्यति राघव।।3.72.25।। दिशो विचेतुं तां सीतां त्वद्वियोगेन शोचतीम्। स ज्ञास्यति वरारोहां निर्मलां रावणालये।।3.72.26।।
metadata.translation: राघव Rama, त्वद्वियोगेन by separation from you, शोचतीम् brooding, तां सीताम् that Sita, विचेतुम् to search, महाकायान् gigantic, वानरांश्च monkeys, दिशः in all directions, प्रेषयिष्यति he will send, सः he, रावणालये in Ravana's home, निर्मलाम् chaste, वरारोहाम् beautiful, ज्ञास्यति will find out.

metadata.explanation: Eager to please Sugriva, the great souls searched  in the forest region. Even there they   could not find Janaka's daughter and also Ravana who had abducted Sita.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्र चापि महात्मानो नापश्यञ्जनकात्मजाम्। हर्तारं रावणं वापि सुग्रीवप्रियकारिणः।।4.48.16।।
metadata.translation: महात्मानः great souls, सुग्रीवप्रियकारिणः eager to please Sugriva, तत्र चापि and there also, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, हर्तारम् one who has abducted, रावणं वापि Ravana also, नापश्यन् could not see.

metadata.explanation: Even a space of four fingers in the inner chambers of Ravana was not left out in his search for Sita.
metadata.shloka_text: चतुरङ्गुलमात्रोऽपि नावकाशः स विद्यते। रावणान्तःपुरे तस्मिन् यं कपिर्न जगाम सः।।5.12.17।।
metadata.translation: तस्मिन् in that, रावणान्तःपुरे in Ravana's inner chambers, सः कपिः monkey, यम् where, न जगाम did not go, सः he, अवकाशः scope, चतुरङ्गुलमात्रोऽपि even four fingers of space, न not विद्यते leaving.

metadata.explanation: Illustrious Hanuman left the banquet hall to renew his effort in search of Sita. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the eleventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
metadata.shloka_text: स भूयस्तु परं श्रीमान् मारुतिर्यत्नमास्थितः।।5.11.47।। आपानभूमिमुत्सृज्य तद्विचेतुं प्रचक्रमे।
metadata.translation: श्रीमान् Illustrious, सः मारुतिः Maruti, भूयः once again, परम् great, यत्नम् effort, आस्थितः made, आपानभूमिम् banquet hall, उत्सृज्य leaving, तत् that, विचेतुम् to search, प्रचक्रमे departed.

metadata.explanation: Searching for Sita at the landings of river Godavari, Lakshmana said to Rama, I am unable to find her at these landings.No one responds to my call.
metadata.shloka_text: तां लक्ष्मणस्तीर्थवती विचित्वा राममब्रवीत्।।3.64.3।। नैनां पश्यामि तीर्थेषु क्रोशतो न शृणोति मे।
metadata.translation: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तीर्थवतीम् having landings, ताम् her, विचित्वा searching, रामम् to Rama, अब्रवीत् said, एनाम् her, तीर्थेषु at the landings, न पश्यामि do not see, मे when I, क्रोशतः called out, न शृणोति no one hears.

metadata.explanation: 'You should search for Ravana as well as Vaidehi everywhere in the thickets of that hill, near the mountain streams and also in caves.
metadata.shloka_text: तस्य काननषण्डेषु निर्घरेषु गुहासु च। रावणस्सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः।।4.43.19।।
metadata.translation: तस्य its, काननषण्डेषु in the thickets, निर्घरेषु near mountain streams, गुहासु च in caves, रावणः Ravana, वैदेह्यासह and Vaidehi, ततस्ततः everywhere, मार्गितव्यः should be searched.

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita in the beautiful places on rivers Bhagirathi, Sarayu, Kausiki and Kalindi, on the great mountains adjacent to river Yamuna, banks of rivers Saraswati, Sindhu, Sona with crystalclear waters, the country of Mahim and Kalamahi adorned with mountains and forests. Proceed to Brahmamala, Videha, Malava, Kasi, Kosala and Maghada with great villages, the country of Pundram, Vanga, the country famous for silk worms and the land with silver caves. (It is the eastern direction of river Saravati between Himavat and Vindhya and not east of Kiskinda)
metadata.shloka_text: नदीं भागीरथीं रम्यां सरयूं कौशिकीं तथा।।4.40.20।। कालिन्दीं यमुनां रम्यां यामुनं च महागिरिम्। सरस्वतीं च सिन्धुं च शोणं मणिनिभोदकम्।।4.40.21।। महीं कालमहीं चैव शैलकाननशोभिताम्। ब्रह्ममालान्विदेहांश्च मालवान्कालिकोसलान्।।4.40.22।। मागधांश्च महाग्रामान्पुण्ड्रांन्वङ्गां स्तथैव च। पत्तनं कोशकाराणां भूमिं च रजताकराम्।।4.40.23।।
metadata.translation: भागीरथीं नदीम् river Bhagirathi, रम्याम् beautiful, सरयूम् Sarayu, तथा so also, कौशिकीम् Kausiki, कालिन्दी Kalindi, रम्याम् picturesque, यमुनाम् Yamuna, यामुनम् found near  Yamuna, महागिरिं च great mountain, सरस्वतीं च and Saraswati, सिन्धुं च and Sindhu, मणिनिभोदकम् with crystalclear water, शोणम् Sona, महीम् Mahim, शैलकाननशोभिताम् picturesque with mountains and forests, कालमहीं चैव and at Kalamahi, ब्रह्ममालान् Brahmamala, विदेहांश्च and Videha, मालवान् Malava, काशिकोसलान् Kasi and Kosala, मागधान् belonging to Maghada, महाग्रामान् च and great villages, पुण्ड्रान् and Pundra, तथैव च in the same order, आङ्गान् Anga, कोशकाराणाम् country of silkworms, भूमिम् kingdom, रजताकराम् silver caves, भूमिं च and the land, मार्गध्वम् you may search for.

metadata.explanation: "This Sita, the consort of Rama was brought from D and akaranya, a place where rakshasas wander."
metadata.shloka_text: इयंचदण्डकारण्याद्रामस्यमहिषीमया । रक्षोभिश्चरितोद्देशादानीताजनकात्मजा ।।6.12.12।।
metadata.translation: रामस्य: Rama's, मया: by me, महिषी: consort, इयम् this, जनकात्मजा: Sita, रक्षोभिः Rakshasas, चरितोद्देशात् wandering place, दण्डकारण्यात् from Dandakaranya, आनीता: brought.

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita in the beautiful places on rivers Bhagirathi, Sarayu, Kausiki and Kalindi, on the great mountains adjacent to river Yamuna, banks of rivers Saraswati, Sindhu, Sona with crystalclear waters, the country of Mahim and Kalamahi adorned with mountains and forests. Proceed to Brahmamala, Videha, Malava, Kasi, Kosala and Maghada with great villages, the country of Pundram, Vanga, the country famous for silk worms and the land with silver caves. (It is the eastern direction of river Saravati between Himavat and Vindhya and not east of Kiskinda)
metadata.shloka_text: नदीं भागीरथीं रम्यां सरयूं कौशिकीं तथा।।4.40.20।। कालिन्दीं यमुनां रम्यां यामुनं च महागिरिम्। सरस्वतीं च सिन्धुं च शोणं मणिनिभोदकम्।।4.40.21।। महीं कालमहीं चैव शैलकाननशोभिताम्। ब्रह्ममालान्विदेहांश्च मालवान्कालिकोसलान्।।4.40.22।। मागधांश्च महाग्रामान्पुण्ड्रांन्वङ्गां स्तथैव च। पत्तनं कोशकाराणां भूमिं च रजताकराम्।।4.40.23।।
metadata.translation: भागीरथीं नदीम् river Bhagirathi, रम्याम् beautiful, सरयूम् Sarayu, तथा so also, कौशिकीम् Kausiki, कालिन्दी Kalindi, रम्याम् picturesque, यमुनाम् Yamuna, यामुनम् found near  Yamuna, महागिरिं च great mountain, सरस्वतीं च and Saraswati, सिन्धुं च and Sindhu, मणिनिभोदकम् with crystalclear water, शोणम् Sona, महीम् Mahim, शैलकाननशोभिताम् picturesque with mountains and forests, कालमहीं चैव and at Kalamahi, ब्रह्ममालान् Brahmamala, विदेहांश्च and Videha, मालवान् Malava, काशिकोसलान् Kasi and Kosala, मागधान् belonging to Maghada, महाग्रामान् च and great villages, पुण्ड्रान् and Pundra, तथैव च in the same order, आङ्गान् Anga, कोशकाराणाम् country of silkworms, भूमिम् kingdom, रजताकराम् silver caves, भूमिं च and the land, मार्गध्वम् you may search for.

metadata.explanation: 'O venerable Lakshmana Dadhimukha as complaining that the fruits and honey have been consumed by the vanara heroes, Angada and others who have come after their search for Sita in the southern direction.
metadata.shloka_text: आर्य लक्ष्मण सम्प्राह वीरो दधिमुखः कपिः। अङ्गदप्रमुखैर्वीरैर्भक्षितं मधु वानरैः।।5.63.14।। विचित्य दक्षिणामाशामागतैर्हरिपुङ्गवैः।
metadata.translation: आर्य O venerable one, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, वीरः hero, कपिः monkey, दधिमुखः Dadhimukha, सम्प्राह to search, दक्षिणाम् southern, आशाम् hope, विचित्य having searched, आगतैः have come, हरिपुङ्गवैः monkey leaders, वीरैः heroic ones, अङ्गदप्रमुखैः Angada and others, वानरैः vanaras, मधु honey, भक्षितम् eaten.

metadata.explanation: 'I searched all over Ravana's harem with a pure mind but I have not seen Janaki'.
metadata.shloka_text: तदिदं मार्गितं तावच्छुद्धेन मनसा मया।।5.11.44।। रावणान्तःपुरं सर्वं दृश्यते न तु जानकी।
metadata.translation: तत् that, मया by me, शुद्धेन with a pure, मनसा mind, इदम् this, सर्वम् all, रावणान्तःपुरम् Ravana's harem, मार्गितम् searched, जानकी तु but Janaki also, न दृश्यते is not seen.

metadata.explanation: "Sugriva promised Rama to undertake search for Sita and Rama assured Sugriva of securing him the kingdom of the monkeys.
metadata.shloka_text: तस्य तेन प्रतिज्ञातं सीतायाः परिमार्गणम्। सुग्रीवस्यापि रामेण हरिराज्यं निवेदितम्।।5.51.9।।
metadata.translation: तेन by him, तस्य his, सीतायाः Sita's, परिमार्गणम् to search, प्रतिज्ञातम् is promised, रामेणापि even by Rama also, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, हरिराज्यम् kingdom of monkeys, निवेदितम् assured.

metadata.explanation: "Rama with Lakshmana went about searching, ranging along the banks of Godavari among the blossomed woods."
metadata.shloka_text: मार्गमाणस्तुवैदेहींराघवंसहलक्ष्मणः । गोदावरीमन्वचरद्वनोद्धेशांश्चपुष्पितान् ।।6.129.34।।
metadata.translation: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, मार्गमाणः searching, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, गोदावरीम् Godavari, पुष्पितान् blossomed, वनोद्देशांश्च ranged along the forest, अन्वचरत् went about

retrieval_results.expandedQuery: The search for Sita begins in earnest in the Aranya Kanda, where Rama and Lakshmana, after meeting with various sages, intensify their efforts to locate Sita following her abduction by Ravana.

generation_result.answer: The search for Sita begins earnestly in the Kishkindha Kanda. Sugriva instructs the vanaras to search all places for Sita, the beloved wife of Rama, in various forests, mountains, and cities [Kishkindha Kanda 40.24]. Particular areas such as Vindhya, Godavari, and Dandaka forest are targeted, with further instructions to explore several countries and riverbanks [Kishkindha Kanda 41.12]. Sugriva organizes the vanara forces and emphasizes their mission to find Sita and the residence of Ravana [Kishkindha Kanda 42.14].

full_response.answer: The search for Sita begins earnestly in the Kishkindha Kanda. Sugriva instructs the vanaras to search all places for Sita, the beloved wife of Rama, in various forests, mountains, and cities [Kishkindha Kanda 40.24]. Particular areas such as Vindhya, Godavari, and Dandaka forest are targeted, with further instructions to explore several countries and riverbanks [Kishkindha Kanda 41.12]. Sugriva organizes the vanara forces and emphasizes their mission to find Sita and the residence of Ravana [Kishkindha Kanda 42.14].
full_response.explanation: The Kishkindha Kanda marks the organized commencement of Sita's search. Sugriva's leadership is evident as he directs the vanaras in their quest to explore geographical areas like Vindhya and river Godavari, as well as several regions and territories [Kishkindha Kanda 40.24, 41.12]. The search involves detailed instructions to scour all possible locations for Sita and Ravana's abode, indicating systematic efforts to locate her [Kishkindha Kanda 42.14].

question: In which Kanda does the search for Sita begin in earnest?

response.user_query: In which Kanda does the search for Sita begin in earnest?
response.expanded_query: The search for Sita begins in earnest in the Aranya Kanda, where Rama and Lakshmana, after realizing her abduction, start their quest to find her.

metadata.explanation: 'Search all over the place looking carefully here and there for Sita the beloved consort of Rama, daughterinlaw of Dasaratha.
metadata.shloka_text: सर्वमेतद्विचेतव्यं मृगयद्भिस्ततस्ततः। रामस्य दयितां भार्यां सीतां दशरथस्नुषाम्।।4.40.24।।
metadata.translation: रामस्य Rama's, दयिताम् dear, भार्याम् wife, दशरथस्नुषाम् daughterinlaw of Dasaratha, सीताम् Sita, ततस्ततः in all places, मृगयद्भि: by searching, तत् सर्वम् all over, विचेतव्यम् search should be made.

metadata.explanation: 'Search for Sita all over Vindhya of a thousand peaks filled with several trees and creepers, and along the river Narmada. Then proceed to Godavari, lovely Krishnaveni, Mahanadi, Varada and Mahabhaga inhabited by terrific serpents.You may search Mekhala, Utkala and Dasarna cities, Asvavanti and Avanti countries also.
metadata.shloka_text: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्। नर्मदां च नदीं रम्यां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.8।। ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णवेणीं महानदीम्। वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.9।। मेखलामुत्कलां चैव दशार्णनगराण्यपि। आश्ववन्तीमवन्तीं च सर्वामेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.10।।
metadata.translation: सहस्रशिरसम् of thousand peaks, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् filled with several trees and creepers, विन्ध्यम् Vindhya, नर्मदां नदीं च and river Narmada, ततः then, रम्याम् delightful, गोदावरीम् Godavari, महानदीम् Mahanadi, कृष्णवेणीम् Krishnaveni, महाभागाम् Mahabhaga, महोरगनिषेविताम् inhabited by terrific serpents, वरदां च and Varada river, मेखलाम् river Mekhala, उत्कलां च एव Utkala also, दशार्णनगराण्यपि towns of Dasarna, आश्ववन्तीम् Asvavanti, अवन्तीम् Avanti, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत you may survey.

metadata.explanation: 'Search for Sita all over Vindhya of a thousand peaks filled with several trees and creepers, and along the river Narmada. Then proceed to Godavari, lovely Krishnaveni, Mahanadi, Varada and Mahabhaga inhabited by terrific serpents.You may search Mekhala, Utkala and Dasarna cities, Asvavanti and Avanti countries also.
metadata.shloka_text: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्। नर्मदां च नदीं रम्यां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.8।। ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णवेणीं महानदीम्। वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.9।। मेखलामुत्कलां चैव दशार्णनगराण्यपि। आश्ववन्तीमवन्तीं च सर्वामेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.10।।
metadata.translation: सहस्रशिरसम् of thousand peaks, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् filled with several trees and creepers, विन्ध्यम् Vindhya, नर्मदां नदीं च and river Narmada, ततः then, रम्याम् delightful, गोदावरीम् Godavari, महानदीम् Mahanadi, कृष्णवेणीम् Krishnaveni, महाभागाम् Mahabhaga, महोरगनिषेविताम् inhabited by terrific serpents, वरदां च and Varada river, मेखलाम् river Mekhala, उत्कलां च एव Utkala also, दशार्णनगराण्यपि towns of Dasarna, आश्ववन्तीम् Asvavanti, अवन्तीम् Avanti, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत you may survey.

metadata.explanation: I will roam about the river Godavari, Janasthana and this mount Prasravana till I find Sita.
metadata.shloka_text: गोदावरीं जनस्थानमिमं प्रस्रवणं गिरिम्।।3.64.14।। सर्वाण्यनुगमिष्यामि यदि सीता हि दृश्यते।
metadata.translation: गोदावरीम् Godavari, जनस्थानम् Janasthanam, इमम् this, प्रस्रवणं Prasravana, गिरिम् mountain, सर्वाणि all, अनुगमिष्यामि will follow up, सीता Sita, यदि हि दृश्यते if Sita can be found.

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्र सीतां च मार्गध्वं निलयं रावणस्य च।।4.42.12।। वेलातलनिविष्टेषु पर्वतेषु वनेषु च। मुरचीपत्तनं चैव रम्यं चैव जटीपुरम्।।4.42.13।। अवन्तीमङ्गलोपां च तथा चालक्षितं वनम्। राष्ट्राणि च विशालानि पत्तनानि ततस्ततः।।4.42.14।।
metadata.translation: तत्र there,वेलातलनिविष्टेषु among those on the sea shore tract, पर्वतेषु in mountains, वनेषु in groves, सीतां च Sita's, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च  residence, मार्गध्वम् search, मुरचीपत्तनं चैव town of Murachi, रम्यम् beautiful, जटपुरं चैव and in the city of Jata, अवन्तीम् in Avanti, अङ्गलोपां च  in Angalopa city, तथा so also, अलक्षितम् unnoticed, वनम्  forest, ततस्ततः here and there, राष्ट्रणिच kingdoms, विशालानि vast, पत्तनानि towns

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita in the countries of Vidarbha and Rishika, in the picturesque country of Mashaka, Vanga and Kalinga and all over Kausika. Look for her in mountains caves and on river banks, in Dandaka forest, in Godavari, in Andhra also in Pundra, Chola and Pandya countries and all over Kerala.
metadata.shloka_text: विदर्भानृषिकांश्चैव रम्यान्माहिषकानपि। तथा वङ्गान्कलिङ्गांश्च कौशिकांश्च समन्ततः।।4.41.11।। अन्वीक्ष्य दण्डकारण्यं सपर्वतनदीगुहाम्। नदीं गोदावरीं चैव सर्वमेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.12।। तथैवान्ध्रांश्च पुण्ड्रांश्च चोलान्पाण्ड्यांत्स केरलान्।
metadata.translation: विदर्भान् in Vidarbha, ऋषिकांश्चैव and in Rishika, रम्यान् picturesque, माहिषकानपि country of  Mahishaka, तथा so also, वङ्गकलिङ्गांश्च Vanga and Kalinga, समन्ततः all over, कौशिकांश्च Kausika, सपर्वतनदीगुहाम् in the mountains, river banks and caves, दण्डकारण्यम् in Dandaka forest, अन्वीक्ष्य after searching for, गोदावरीं Godavari, नदीं river, चैव also, तथैव in the same way, आन्ध्रांश्च Andhra also, पुण्ड्रांश्च country Pundra even, चोलान् Chola, पाण्ड्यांत्स Pandya country, केरलान् Kerala, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत search.

metadata.explanation: 'Search for Sita all over Vindhya of a thousand peaks filled with several trees and creepers, and along the river Narmada. Then proceed to Godavari, lovely Krishnaveni, Mahanadi, Varada and Mahabhaga inhabited by terrific serpents.You may search Mekhala, Utkala and Dasarna cities, Asvavanti and Avanti countries also.
metadata.shloka_text: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्। नर्मदां च नदीं रम्यां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.8।। ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णवेणीं महानदीम्। वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम्।।4.41.9।। मेखलामुत्कलां चैव दशार्णनगराण्यपि। आश्ववन्तीमवन्तीं च सर्वामेवानुपश्यत।।4.41.10।।
metadata.translation: सहस्रशिरसम् of thousand peaks, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् filled with several trees and creepers, विन्ध्यम् Vindhya, नर्मदां नदीं च and river Narmada, ततः then, रम्याम् delightful, गोदावरीम् Godavari, महानदीम् Mahanadi, कृष्णवेणीम् Krishnaveni, महाभागाम् Mahabhaga, महोरगनिषेविताम् inhabited by terrific serpents, वरदां च and Varada river, मेखलाम् river Mekhala, उत्कलां च एव Utkala also, दशार्णनगराण्यपि towns of Dasarna, आश्ववन्तीम् Asvavanti, अवन्तीम् Avanti, सर्वमेव all over, अनुपश्यत you may survey.

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
metadata.shloka_text: तत्र सीतां च मार्गध्वं निलयं रावणस्य च।।4.42.12।। वेलातलनिविष्टेषु पर्वतेषु वनेषु च। मुरचीपत्तनं चैव रम्यं चैव जटीपुरम्।।4.42.13।। अवन्तीमङ्गलोपां च तथा चालक्षितं वनम्। राष्ट्राणि च विशालानि पत्तनानि ततस्ततः।।4.42.14।।
metadata.translation: तत्र there,वेलातलनिविष्टेषु among those on the sea shore tract, पर्वतेषु in mountains, वनेषु in groves, सीतां च Sita's, रावणस्य Ravana's, निलयं च  residence, मार्गध्वम् search, मुरचीपत्तनं चैव town of Murachi, रम्यम् beautiful, जटपुरं चैव and in the city of Jata, अवन्तीम् in Avanti, अङ्गलोपां च  in Angalopa city, तथा so also, अलक्षितम् unnoticed, वनम्  forest, ततस्ततः here and there, राष्ट्रणिच kingdoms, विशालानि vast, पत्तनानि towns

metadata.explanation: 'Look for Sita in the countries of Vidarbha and Rishika, in the picturesque country of Mashaka, Vanga and Kalinga and all over Kausika. Look for her in mountains caves and on river banks, in Dandaka forest, in Godavari, in Andhra also in Pundra, Chola and Pandya countries and all over Kerala.
